Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 14, mean = 43, sd = 8.08 Sample 2: n = 20, mean = 53, sd = 11.67. The pooled variance estimator takes the value 107.38. It is tested whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 13 and 19 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 34 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 14 and 20 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 32 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 13 and 19 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 34 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 14 and 20 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 32 degrees of freedom: Correct
